astro/

mm_dist.pro


top source mM_dist

Astro

result = mM_dist(mM=mM, dist=dist)

Converts between distance modulus m-M and distance in parsecs.

Return value

If mM is specified, then Result is the distance in parsecs. If DIST is specified, then Result is the distance modulus m-M.

Keywords

mM in

Input distance modulus m-M.

dist in

Input distance in parsecs.

Examples

Calculate distance of an object with distance modulus m-M=16.8: distance = mM_DIST(mM=16.8) Calculate the distance modulus of an object at 350pc: distmod = mM_DIST(DIST=350.)

Author information
